result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scottie L. Wenzlick

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:47 PM Defendant Scottie L. Wenzlick in court with attorney John Zich, via zoom by both. Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. explains why appeared via zoom.  Court will allow.  Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Scottie L. Wenzlick
Current: 660 Clark St, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2022)
Prior: 1204 4th Ave, Antigo, WI 54409
Def. to take all medication as prescribed.

02:58 PM Defendant Scottie L. Wenzlick in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to represent himself.  State heard on mental health issues. State has concern and would like to have case put on Judge Rhode calendar.  Def. did apply for P.D. State has complied with victim rights. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Court orders $2500 signature bond with conditions.  Court will allow def. to appear via zoom or telephone  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
